Comment.Language: Chanted in the tune of "Blessed be the Father (Je f~c~marwout)" (Standard Melodies) or "Who Am I (Anok Nim)"

Text.Language: Iwann/c p~s/ri n~Za,ariac: aucaji eyb/tf eujw m~moc: n~je nimay/t/c n~te P%: qen pieuaggelion e#y#u#.
The disciples of the Lord, have spoken about you, O John the son of Zacharias, in the Holy Gospel saying.

"Among those born of women, no one is greater than you, O John the Baptist, the son of Zacharias."

Isaiah spoke about, John the forerunner saying, "Behold voice of One crying in the wilderness, prepare the way of the Lord God."

Iwann/c pibaptict/c: perouot n~te nisafeu: ouoh v~rasi n~te Piiordan/c: pikurix n~te ]meteuceb/c.
John the Baptist, the gladness of the wilderness, and the joy of the Jordan, and the caller with reverence.

John the priest of God, the kinsman of Christ, the son of the priest, and the son of the barren one.

John the Baptist, the prophet of the High One, who is of the honored name, more than all the prophets.

At the time of the ninth, hour at night, our Savior Jesus Christ, came to John the forerunner.

Christ spoke with Him, in meekness saying, "Arise with Me O John and go, to the waters of the Jordan."

I am Jesus the Son of God, You are John son of Zacharias, I am Jesus Son of the Virgin, you are John son of Elizabeth."

John said "O Lord I am, not worthy to baptize You," Jesus said "We have to perfect, all righteousness - listen to Me."
